reviews.review: Half-Life was an incredible game for its time, and it still holds up today. Great game, buy if you want a good FPS at a low price.

In many ways the original is still the best. Graphics are old, but they are super slick and clear. When combined with the game mechanics, it makes the shoot out a purists experience where speed and accuracy are rewarded. The first story is also the best of all, not complicated, with great characters, acting, and no constant 'friend' presence to have to manage either (sorry Alyx).  Even the soundtrack is just better than anything which came afterwards.  Somehow all the subsequent improvement attempts (e.g. source, black mesa) whilst technically are 'better', just detract from the rawness and punch of the original.

All in all, it is truly a gripping game from start to finish - traps, jokes, puzzles, hidden achievements and plenty of trigger action..   Has never been bettered by any game I've ever played. 

If you don't know half-life, close your ears and eyes to everything that is on the web and just open this game and play it as if you've never heard of it, or you don't know what its all about. Guaranteed it will be the memorable game experience of your life....

interesting game, don't be confused by my hours, I played it out offline on another pc.

It's a no brainer to get if it's on sale.

Despite this game being a complete pain in my ass for a majority of my 29 hours playing, I still found a lot of sections to be enjoyable. Despite what most say, I think the Xen sections are actually much more enjoyable and don't suffer from the cheap bullshit you'll find in the first two thirds of the game. Nihilanth is a bitch to kill, but was a enjoyable fight. Overall, if you are a fan of retro games, you'll enjoy this blast to the past. I believe anyone, if given the chance, should play this game, with one small forewarning: You'll be a lot looser in your back end than when you started, because this game will buttfuck you often, so be prepared when playing on any difficulty above easy. Be sure to bring lube to make it easier. c:

Half-Life es un juego de acci√≥n en primera persona lleno de acci√≥n, con una gran historia y personajes muy realistas. La emoci√≥n existe desde el principio, y los jugadores estar√°n profundamente involucrados con numerosas historias y muchas sorpresas. Los jugadores deben buscar cient√≠ficos y guardias de seguridad para obtener acceso a √°reas restringidas de las instalaciones de Black Mesa, incluso si esto incluye rescatarlos de situaciones peligrosas.

Eres Gordon Freeman, un sobreviviente del accidente de Black Mesa. Atrapado en medio de la destrucci√≥n, fuiste salvado por tu traje de seguridad. Es tu trabajo escapar, pero con un permiso de seguridad limitado, y la mayor√≠a de las v√≠as de acceso destruidas, asi que tendr√°s que luchar para salir. Est√°s casi fuera de las instalaciones de Black Mesa cuando te encuentras con un soldado. Sin pensarlo, te disparan y matan a numerosos cient√≠ficos. El gobierno ha enviado tropas y francotiradores para eliminar todo en las instalaciones de Black Mesa, incluido usted.

Todo en este juego es perfecto. Half-Life no es un juego, es una aventura.

I like this game.  There's a lot of old games I never got the chance of playing  during their initial release so I'll play them years later and find the gameplay/story to be stale cause it's just aged terribly.  I tried Half Life for the first time in 2014 and loved it.  I compare its aspects to Halo which I grew up on since 2002 and am biased to say is my favorite fps but Half Life sticks out as an amazing fps despite being old in gaming.

As much as I love the Half-Life series, I can't say that the original version of Half-Life has aged very well. Low model quality and textures combined with the occasionally clunky controls and physics makes for an FPS adventure that is a bit rough around the edges. Still - the gameplay itself is solid with a wide weapon sandbox available to you, and can still be challenging on the Nth playthrough. An very good game - but I'd recommend the newer Source remake, Black Mesa, if you want a more modernized experience.
